solution_line_template: She orders {num_quiches} quiches for ${quiche_price} each so they cost {num_quiches}*{quiche_price} = $<<{num_quiches}*{quiche_price}={quiche_total}>>{quiche_total}
She orders {num_croissants} croissants at ${croissant_price} each so they cost {num_croissants}*2.5 = $<<{num_croissants}*{croissant_price}={croissant_total}>>{croissant_total}
She orders {num_biscuits} biscuits at ${biscuit_price} each so they cost {num_biscuits}*2 = $<<{num_biscuits}*{biscuit_price}={biscuit_total}>>{biscuit_total}
Her advance order is over $50.00 so she can get 10% off so {discount_percent_decimal}*{order_total} = ${discount_amount}
Her order is ${order_total} and she gets ${discount_amount} off so her advanced order will cost {order_total}-{discount_amount}=$<<{order_total}-{discount_amount}={final_total}>>{final_total}
